text: Charles Leffingwell Bartlett (August 14, 1921 â€“ February 17, 2017) was an American journalist. He won the 1956 Pulitzer Prize for National Reporting "for his original disclosures that led to the resignation of Harold E. Talbott as Secretary of the Air Force.""National Reporting". The Pulitzer Prizes. Retrieved 2013-10-27. He was born in Chicago. He is best known for introducing Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis to John F. Kennedy at a dinner party in the 1950s. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Journalists from Chicago Category:Pulitzer Prize winners Category:Deaths from heart failure
title: Charles L. Bartlett (journalist)
